desc_content.paragraph: Curve data-block used for storing text
Text horizontal align from the object center

list_item.paragraph: LEFT Left, Align text to the left.
RIGHT Right, Align text to the right.
JUSTIFY Justify, Align to the left and the right.
FLUSH Flush, Align to the left and the right, with equal character spacing.

desc_content.paragraph: Text vertical align from the object center

list_item.paragraph: TOP_BASELINE Top Base-Line, Align to top but use the base-line of the text.
TOP Top, Align text to the top.
CENTER Center, Align text to the middle.
BOTTOM Bottom, Align text to the bottom.
BOTTOM_BASELINE Bottom Base-Line, Align text to the bottom but use the base-line of the text.

desc_content.paragraph: Stores the style of each character

Use Objects as font characters (give font objects a common name followed by the character they represent, eg. ‘family-a’, ‘family-b’, etc, set this setting to ‘family-‘, and turn on Vertex Duplication)
Horizontal offset from the object origin
Vertical offset from the object origin
Handle the text behaviour when it doesn’t fit in the text boxes

list_item.paragraph: NONE Overflow, Let the text overflow outside the text boxes.
SCALE Scale to Fit, Scale down the text to fit inside the text boxes.
TRUNCATE Truncate, Truncate the text that would go outside the text boxes.

desc_content.paragraph: Uses the UV values as Generated textured coordinates

field_body.paragraph: The RNA type or default when not found.
The class or default when not found.
